intro: Brachistus physocalycius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved brachistus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a low, sprawling shrub with narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, forming dense clusters that bloom in late spring. Brachistus physocalycius is well adapted to hot, dry environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
